greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest divisor of n having the form 2^i*5^j.
comment: Multiplicative with a(2^e)=2^e, a(5^e)=5^e and a(p^e)=1 for p=3 or p>=7. - _R. J. Mathar_, Sep 06 2011
The range of this sequence, { a(n); n>=0 }, is equal to A003592. - _M. F. Hasler_, Dec 28 2015
link: R. Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: A132741 := proc(n) local f,a; f := ifactors(n)[2] ; a := 1; for f in ifactors(n)[2] do if op(1,f) =2 then a := a*2^op(2,f) ; elif op(1,f) =5 then a := a*5^op(2,f) ; end if; end do;a; end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Sep 06 2011
mathematica: a[n_] := SelectFirst[Reverse[Divisors[n]], MatchQ[FactorInteger[#], {{1, 1}} | {{2, _}} | {{5, _}} | {{2, _}, {5, _}}]&]; Array[a, 100] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 02 2018 *)
program: f p y x | r == 0    = f p (y * p) x'
| otherwise = if p == 2 then f 5 y x else y
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 27 2007
